intro: Ouratea barrae, commonly known as the Barra Ouratea, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the family Ochnaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, white to pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a waxy texture, while its fruits are capsules that release small seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Ouratea barrae is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
